body:
Core Wasm JS<->Wasm function objects and glue:
- src/wasm/wasm-objects.h
  - WasmExportedFunction (JSFunction subclass): Represents an exported wasm function. New(...): create with WasmTrustedInstanceData, WasmFuncRef, WasmInternalFunction, arity, and export wrapper Code. GetDebugName(sig) to name wrappers. SharedFunctionInfo stores WasmExportedFunctionData.
  - WasmJSFunction (JSFunction subclass): Represents a JS-created WebAssembly.Function wrapping a JS callable. New(...): signature and callable + suspend mode, owns WasmJSFunctionData which handles wrapper lifetime (OffheapData holding CPT entry and decrement refcount on GC).
  - WasmFunctionData/WasmExportedFunctionData/WasmJSFunctionData: function-data payloads referenced from SharedFunctionInfo. Fields:
    • WasmFunctionData: code pointer to wrapper_code; protected internal WasmInternalFunction; bitfields for Suspend and Promise.
    • WasmExportedFunctionData: protected instance_data, strong code pointer c_wrapper_code, CanonicalSig* and CanonicalTypeIndex; methods is_promising(), MatchesSignature.
    • WasmJSFunctionData: protected OffheapData TrustedManaged that owns a CodePointerTable entry for wrapper, and APIs to set compiled or generic wrapper; stores callable, suspend, CanonicalSig* and CanonicalTypeIndex.
  - WasmImportData: stores trusted_instance_data, call_origin (either WasmDispatchTable with table slot or WasmInternalFunction), suspend and table_slot fields.
  - WasmInternalFunction: contains protected implicit_arg (TrustedObject) and call_target CodePointer; try_get_external/GetOrCreateExternal to produce external JSFunction as needed.
  - WasmFuncRef: heap object pointing to WasmInternalFunction; used for externref<func> crossing ToJS/FromJS conversions.
  - WasmDispatchTable/WasmDispatchTableData: trusted object used by indirect calls and imports. SetForWrapper installs generic or compiled wrapper targets; DispatchTableData tracks wrapper ownership and refcounts.
  - WasmTrustedInstanceData: central trusted state for an instance (pointers to memories, tables, dispatch_tables, jump_table_start, tiering_budget_array, etc.). Provides FunctionTargetAndImplicitArg and GetCallTarget; func_refs cache; UseGenericWasmToJSWrapper decision helper at end of file; fields include tiering_budget_array related to tiering controller.
  - Promise/suspender glue: WasmSuspenderObject, WasmResumeData and promise integration fields used by wrappers for suspension/resumption.
- Conversions visible to wrappers (used by wrappers.cc and compiler builders):
  - wasm::JSToWasmObject(Isolate*, Handle<Object> value, CanonicalValueType expected, ...)
  - wasm::WasmToJSObject(Isolate*, Handle<Object> value)
- Key fields used by wrappers.cc:
  - WasmExportedFunctionData::kProtectedInternalOffset (in wrappers.cc used to load internal function)
  - WasmInternalFunction::kRawCallTargetOffset (for code pointer table index), kExternalOffset.
  - WasmFuncRef::kTrustedInternalOffset (to extract internal function for func refs).
  - WasmImportData::kNativeContextOffset, kCallableOffset (used by wasm-to-js wrappers).
explanation: Addresses item (3): objects and glue used around wrappers, how function objects carry wrapper code and internal function references, and how dispatch tables/wrapper lifetime are handled.
file_line: wasm/wasm-objects.h: all relevant class definitions; cross-checked with wasm/wrappers.cc loads at offsets
